    while n > 0:

    if n_fact > n:

    if n_fact == n:

        while n_fact < n:

            n_fact += 1

    return n_fact

    brazilian_factorial(n) = n! * (n-1)! * (n-2)! * ... * 1!
    where n > 0

    For example:
    >>> special_factorial(4)
    288

    The function will receive an integer as input and should return the special
    factorial of this integer.
    """
    return 1 * n * (n-1) * (n-2) *... * special_factorial(n-2) + 1
